intro: Sphaerostephanos pilosiusculis, commonly known as the hairy spherical stephanos, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apocynaceae. It is characterized by its spherical or globose inflorescence, which consists of small, clustered flowers. The plant typically has hairy foliage and stems, giving it a distinctive appearance. It is native to certain regions of South America, particularly Brazil. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
